Directions: Use the information to answer each question that follows.
Content: The ecosystems of western Canada include mountainous terrain covered in forests that usually receive snowfall five to eight months a year. Two animals that live in these forests are the Canada lynx and the snowshoe hare.
Scientists gathered data about the populations of Canada lynx and snowshoe hares. These graphs show how populations of lynx and hares changed over time.
These maps show the ranges of Canada lynx and snowshoe hares.
